channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [OAK-721] NamePathMapperImpl: weird error message "index > 1"
item.description: I sometimes get the error with the message "index > 1" in NamePathMapperImpl. I have no idea what it means and why I get it.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Revision 1461547: Improved message. But I still have no idea what the error means, or even what the parameters "name" and "index" mean.

The error message and stack trace is now for example:

 org.apache.jackrabbit.oak.plugins.observation.ChangeProcessor Unable to generate or send events java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: index = 2 for path /jcr:system/jcr:nodeTypes/cq:PollConfig/jcr:propertyDefinition[2] and name jcr:propertyDefinition
	at org.apache.jackrabbit.oak.namepath.NamePathMapperImpl$1.error(NamePathMapperImpl.java:104)
	at org.apache.jackrabbit.oak.namepath.NamePathMapperImpl$1.name(NamePathMapperImpl.java:110)
	at org.apache.jackrabbit.oak.namepath.JcrNameParser.parse(JcrNameParser.java:211)
	at org.apache.jackrabbit.oak.namepath.JcrPathParser.parse(JcrPathParser.java:111)
	at org.apache.jackrabbit.oak.namepath.NamePathMapperImpl.getJcrPath(NamePathMapperImpl.java:118)
	at org.apache.jackrabbit.oak.plugins.observation.ChangeProcessor$EventGeneratingNodeStateDiff.jcrPath(ChangeProcessor.java:165)
	at org.apache.jackrabbit.oak.plugins.observation.ChangeProcessor$EventGeneratingNodeStateDiff.propertyChanged(ChangeProcessor.java:184)
	at org.apache.jackrabbit.oak.spi.state.AbstractNodeState.comparePropertiesAgainstBaseState(AbstractNodeState.java:222)
	at org.apache.jackrabbit.oak.spi.state.AbstractNodeState.compareAgainstBaseState(AbstractNodeState.java:101)
	at org.apache.jackrabbit.oak.kernel.KernelNodeState.compareAgainstBaseState(KernelNodeState.java:344)
	at org.apache.jackrabbit.oak.plugins.observation.ChangeProcessor$EventGeneratingNodeStateDiff.childNodeChanged(ChangeProcessor.java:234)
	at org.apache.jackrabbit.oak.spi.state.AbstractNodeState.compareAgainstBaseState(AbstractNodeState.java:112)
	at org.apache.jackrabbit.oak.kernel.KernelNodeState.compareAgainstBaseState(KernelNodeState.java:344)
	at org.apache.jackrabbit.oak.plugins.observation.ChangeProcessor$EventGeneratingNodeStateDiff.childNodeChanged(ChangeProcessor.java:234)
	at org.apache.jackrabbit.oak.spi.state.AbstractNodeState.compareAgainstBaseState(AbstractNodeState.java:112)
	at org.apache.jackrabbit.oak.kernel.KernelNodeState.compareAgainstBaseState(KernelNodeState.java:344)
	at org.apache.jackrabbit.oak.plugins.observation.ChangeProcessor$EventGeneratingNodeStateDiff.childNodeChanged(ChangeProcessor.java:234)
	at org.apache.jackrabbit.oak.spi.state.AbstractNodeState.compareAgainstBaseState(AbstractNodeState.java:112)
	at org.apache.jackrabbit.oak.kernel.KernelNodeState.compareAgainstBaseState(KernelNodeState.java:344)
	at org.apache.jackrabbit.oak.plugins.observation.ChangeProcessor$EventGeneratingNodeStateDiff.childNodeChanged(ChangeProcessor.java:234)
	at org.apache.jackrabbit.oak.spi.state.AbstractNodeState.compareAgainstBaseState(AbstractNodeState.java:112)
	at org.apache.jackrabbit.oak.kernel.KernelNodeState.compareAgainstBaseState(KernelNodeState.java:344)
	at org.apache.jackrabbit.oak.core.RootImpl$3.getChanges(RootImpl.java:346)
	at org.apache.jackrabbit.oak.plugins.observation.ChangeProcessor.run(ChangeProcessor.java:115)

Could the index could be the "same name sibling index"?

Could the index could be the "same name sibling index"?

Yes, that's the case here.

This looks like a regression from my recent change to make the "fake SNS" nodes under /jcr:system/jcr:nodeTypes use the real SNS index syntax like "jcr:propertyDefinition[2]" instead of dummy names like "jcr:propertyDefinition2".

I'll update the JcrPathParser code to cope better with such path elements.
In revision 1461572 I committed a change that should allow such SNS paths without errors.
